result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Nycz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 34 days were granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1471.00 from read in case 15CF544 to be paid to R.K.   Bail to be applied to restitution.  Restitution paid in full.  Surcharges to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No violent contact with C.C. and R.K.  Contact conditions as deemed appropriate by Agent.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Defendant to not to possess any weapons/firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions consecutive to each case - STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.
Consecutive to: to each case.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin J Nycz in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
9 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 34 days).  Concurrent. 
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with C.C. and R.K. Contact conditions as deemed appropriate by agent.  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
Condition Time: 10 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS consecutive to each case-  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
Restitution: Total amount of $1471.00 from read in case #15CF554 to be paid to R.K. Bail to be applied from cases 15CF892, 13CM2260, and 14CM2372
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 01-25-2016 10:00 am
